info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 8:53PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hamlin, southern Clark and southeastern Spink Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 953 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clark Colony, or 14 miles west of Clark, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fordham Colony around 1000 PM CDT. Carpenter around 1010 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Willow Lake, Mayfield Colony and Bryant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
